title: Best Bets, Oct. 23-25
text:
Michelle Almonte , malmonte@lohud.com 10:36 a.m. EDT October 20, 2015 Buy Photo Thousands of spectators enjoyed the festivities at the 27th annual Nyack Halloween Parade in Nyack, NY on October 25, 2014 (Photo: , Kurt Beebe for The Journal News) Buy Photo 7 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Halloween Parades 
It's going to be tough to choose, but fans on either side of the Hudson can get to a Halloween parade this weekend. Expect to see thousands of spectators, floats and costumes at the Nyack Halloween Parade. The festivities kick off with live music in Main St. Parking Lot before the parade steps off from Memorial Park. Parade starts at 5:30 p.m. but festivities are held from 3-7:30 p.m. Saturday. All are welcome to march and register for prizes for the best costumes and floats. 845-353-2221, nyackchamber.org . In Tarrytown, the parade steps off from Patriots Park at 5:30 p.m. Saturday and heads down Broadway to Main Street, where there's a block party following the march with food, live performances and DJs. Rain date is Sunday. 
Westchester's Ridge Hill’s Harvestfest 
Trick-or-treaters can get a jump start on Halloween at Harvestfest . Children are encouraged to come in costume and trick or treat. There's pumpkin decorating, pony rides, arts and crafts, demonstrations and a petting zoo keep the little ones entertained–while adults can learn some new moves during a square dancing session with Live bluegrass and satisfy food and drink cravings with seasonal dishes from local eateries and beer tastings from the Broken Bow brewery. Free admission. Noon-4 p.m. Saturday. 1 Ridge Hill Boulevard, Yonkers. 914-207-2900. Westchestersridgehill.com 
HarvestFest at Ridge Hill (Photo: Photo by Michael Hnatov) 
Walk for Peace OUTside Campus 
Get in shape and support a worthy cause at the 11th annual 5K Lindsey Run/Walk on Sunday. Organized by PEACE OUTside campus and the Lindsey M. Bonistall Foundation, the event is held at Purchase College, 735 Anderson Hill Road, Purchase. Lindsey Bonistall was a University of Delaware sophomore from White Plains who was murdered in her off-campus apartment in Delaware in 2005. For more information about PEACE OUTside Campus, visit www.peaceoutside Buy Photo 
Runners and walkers can participate in the 11th annual 5K Lindsey Run/Walk at Purchase College. (Photo: Ricky Flores, Staff TJN) 
Dino-might fun for young and old 
Little ones who don’t necessarily want to be scared silly on Halloween will love this dinosaur-themed Halloween train show at Lasdon Park. It has dinosaur dioramas and exhibits, and the movie “Rexy the Dinosaur,” along with a hay maze and hayrides. Visit on Saturday and Sunday and Oct. 31 and Nov. 1. 11 a.m. - 3:30 p.m. Admission $7 adults, $3 children ages 2 - 12. Additional fees for other activities. Adults can have their fun, too, at this year’s Rock ‘N Roar Prehistoric Halloween Party! Live music, food, prizes for best costumes. Takes place 7-11 p.m. Oct. 30. Adults only! Tickets are $60 each and can be purchased online. Go to Lasdonpark.org for more information or call 914-864-7268. 2610 Amawalk Road, Route 35, Katonah. 
Kids will find plenty to do at Lasdon's dinosaur-themed Halloween Train Show. (Photo: Photo courtesy of Ted Kozlowdki) 
Garland Jeffreys Band 
Jam with Garland Jeffreys and his band as they strut their musical stuff at the next Words & Music concert series Friday. Jeffreys produced his newest album “Truth Serum” with production support by James Maddock and Larry Campbell. Tickets are $30 and can be purchased at budarztheater.brownpapertickets.com . 8 p.m. Ossining Public Library, 53 Croton Ave. 
Twitter: @MaMalmonte 
More to do this weekend! 
Find a new, interactive calendar of events at events.lohud.com . Users can create a profile, add favorites, and search events by subject, location and date. Buy Photo 
Garland Jeffreys performed at Sunday’s Rockland-Bergen Music Festival at the German Masonic Park in Tappan. (Photo: Robert Brum/The Journal News) 7 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read or Share this story: http://lohud.us/1LImo9W MORE STORIES
